CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lawrence Miller, visiting nurse, 7629 Bennett Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, pg. 32 with question: "Do you believe in capital punishment? If so, do you  think that it should be imposed on convicted defendants under the age of 21?" answer reads: "No, I really don't.  I just do not believe that one person has the right to take the life of another.  There are many other effective ways of punishment.  Sentencing persons to death penalty does not deter similar brutal crimes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Lawrence Miller, wearing light colored hat and coat with large buttons, standing with hands clasped together holding paper bag on sidewalk in front of wooden door of building, another version
